intro: Cheilanthes bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored rock fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive bicolor fronds, with the upper surface typically green and the lower surface often pale or white. This plant is adapted to grow in rocky or crevice environments, often in arid or semi-arid regions. It has a rhizomatous growth habit and produces small, spore-bearing sporangia on the underside of its leaves. Cheilanthes bicolor is a hardy, drought-tolerant species that thrives in well-drained soils.
